com.github.davidcarboni.cryptolite

Class Generate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.davidcarboni.cryptolite.Generate

  • public class Generate
extends Object
    Generates things that need to be random, including salt, token and password values.
    Author:
    David Carboni

    • Field Summary

      The algorithm for the SecureRandom instance.
      static int SALT_BYTES
      The length for salt values.
      static int TOKEN_BITS
      The length for tokens.

    • Method Detail

      • byteArray

        public static byte[] byteArray(int length)
        Instantiates and populates a byte array of the specified length.
        Parameters:
        length - The length of the array.
        Returns:
        SecureRandom.nextBytes(byte[])

      • token

        public static String token()
        Generates a random token.
        Returns:
        A 256-bit (32 byte) random token as a hexadecimal string.

      • password

        public static String password(int length)
        Generates a random password.
        Parameters:
        length - The length of the password to be returned.
        Returns:
        A password of the specified length, selected from passwordCharacters.

      • salt

        public static String salt()
        Generates a random salt value.

        If a salt value is needed by an API call, the documentation of that method should reference this method. Other than than, it should not be necessary to call this in normal usage of this library.

        Returns:
        A random salt value of SALT_BYTES length, as a base64-encoded string (for easy storage).
